content.description: Climb the center of the short slab to a ledge. Follow features up the center of the headwall placing gear to the natural thread anchor on top.
content.location: Center of the Lower Left End

content.description: Climb up a short wall to gain the obvious crack on the right side of the headwall. Follow the fun crack/face climbing to the natural thread anchor on top.
content.protection: A couple bigger cams and nuts
content.location: Right edge of the Lower Left End

content.description: Start the same as Crescent Roof. Climb the slab past flakes and a pin to a ledge. Move back and climb out the small left facing corner/crack. Finish at the trees above. Watch for loose blocks near the top.

Climb up a short low angle slab with optional gear to a pin. Gain the left arÃªte of the headwall and clip a pin with gear for back-up. Make an awesome crux move to a bucket flake over the roof and continue on easy terrain to the top. Natural thread anchor to the right. The route will feel easier if you are tall.
content.location: Left edge of the lower left end

content.description: The route has one or two good move on it but that is it. Its kinda an adventure route because it has two dirt filled ledges on it. The crux is pulling up on the bolder on top. Its worth doing at least once.
content.location: Down the hill about twenty feet from Cresent Roof

pathTokens: New Durham Area  (Longstack, Devil's Den, Rines Hill, etc.)

content.description: The Tombstone Wall is short, but offers some great moderate climbing. This also a great place to climb in the shade on hot days.
